revised_title: Experimental Examination of the Quantity and Proportion of Mechanic Power in Giving Velocity to Heavy Bodies
tldr: The author, John Smeaton, conducted experiments to determine the quantity and proportion of mechanical power needed to give different velocities to heavy bodies. He found that the practical theory of water and wind mills was imperfectly understood and that the conclusions of renowned authors were often incorrect. Smeaton's experiments provided a clearer understanding of the mechanics involved and helped improve the design of mills.
